name: Paraneoplastic Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (PNMOSD)
chief_complaint: I've been having blurry vision, weakness in my legs, and frequent nausea for weeks.
physical_findings: decreased muscle strength (3/5) in lower extremities
prognosis: Guarded - 60% achieve partial remission with treatment, but relapses are common without continuous immunosuppression
description: A rare paraneoplastic variant of NMOSD associated with occult malignancies (often thymoma or lung cancer) where autoantibodies against aquaporin-4 channels cause simultaneous inflammatory demyelination of optic nerves and spinal cord. Distinguished from classic NMOSD by its rapid progression and poorer response to first-line therapies.
